sentence.Network_en: The guards checked at the peephole before entering.
sentence.Network_cn: 卫兵进入前透过门镜检查了一下。

sentence.Network_en: Through the peephole I said to him: " My key off in the lock. "
sentence.Network_cn: 对着门上的窥孔,我对他说: “ 我的钥匙断在锁里了. ”

entry.def: A peephole is small hole in a door or wall through which you can look secretly at what is happening on the other side.

example.ex: The guards checked at the peephole before entering.
example.tran: 卫兵进入前透过门镜检查了一下。

means.word_mean: 1. a hole (in a door or an oven etc) through which you can peep

auth_sentence.content: Through the peephole I saw a white face, distorted and balloonish.
auth_sentence.res_content: Through the peephole I saw a white face, distorted and balloonish.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Through the peephole I saw a white face, distorted and balloonish.
